Upgrade to a newer browser to experience this site in all it's glory. Menu Contact Us Home Contact Us St Augustine's School, Sandybed Lane, Scarborough, North Yorkshire. YO12 5LH Telephone : 01723 363280 Email: admin@sasyorks.org Web: www.sasyorks.org For all media enquiries please contact: Mr Ben Peck +44 7713 517393 Enquiries / Head of School: Miss R Flanagan Chair of the Board of Trustees: Mr David Laws CEO: Mrs Rachel McEvoy St Augustine's School is a member of the St Cuthbert's Roman Catholic Academy Trust Registered office: c/o. St Mary's College, Cranbrook Avenue, HULL. HU6 7TN Company Number: 09023802 (England & Wales) School opening hours The school Reception is open at the following hours: Monday - Thursday: 8.15am-4.30pm Friday: 8.15am-4.00pm PUPILS SHOULD NOT ARRIVE ON SITE IN THE MORNING BEFORE 8.30AM FOR SAFETY REASONS. Thank you for your cooperation. Requests for copies Paper copies or translations of the information on our website can be made available on request. Please email admin@sasyorks.org and reference the page of the document that you wish. Your details Please use the form below to get in touch with us. We aim to respond to all enquiries within one business day. Leave this field blank Your Query Title Please Select Mr Mrs Miss Dr First Name Last Name Telephone Number Email Address Line 1 Address Line 2 Town/City Country Please Select UK Postcode Submit We will not pass your details on to third parties. See our privacy policy for more information. Contact St. Augustine's Centre: Discover our contact details, location, and how to join our mailing list. Skip to main content I Need Help English English Classes Podcast Advice and Support Asylum and Immigration Housing Health Families and Children Refugee Move On Activities Events and Trips Sports Arts & Music Befriending Cycle Club Chill Out Room Other ways we help Food Free Shop and Salon I Can Help Donate Jobs Volunteer Partner With Us Fundraise Campaign Latest News and Stories Podcasts Content Library About What We Do Our Funders Safeguarding Find Us Donate Now Search Contact Subscribe × Search the site Search for: × Contact St Augustine's Centre Your Name (Required) First Last Your Phone (Required) Your Email (Required) Your Enquiry (Required) CAPTCHA URL This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged. × Subscribe to our Newsletter CAPTCHA Email Address Contact us info@staugustinescentrehalifax.org.uk St Augustine’s Centre Hanson Lane Halifax HX1 5PG what3words: ///pumps.popped.fallen For general enquiries please call 01422 352492. We are open Monday-Thursday 9:30am – 3:30pm. For advice and support, come along to our advice drop-in on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, from 9.30 – 11.30am. How to find us By bike Please use the Google Map at the top of this page for directions. Use the postcode HX1 5PG. We have bike racks you can use. They are behind the fence near the containers. Please speak to reception if you need help. By bus If you are travelling by bus to Halifax, you can walk from the bus station, please look at the Google Map at the top of this page for directions. Alternatively, you can take bus 21 from Halifax directly to St Augustine’s Centre. The bus leaves Market Street, stand number 15, every half an hour in the direction of Pellon. The bus takes 7 minutes. You should get off the bus on it’s 6th stop, called Hanson Lane Bowman Grove. This bus stop is opposite St Augustine’s Centre. By car We have some car parking spaces and road side parking. We recommend you park your car on the road in front of the centre. Our postcode for your SatNav is HX1 5PG. Please use the Google Map at the top of this page for directions. By train It’s a 30 minute walk from Halifax train station to St Augustine’s Centre. Or a 10 minute taxi ride for about £5. Walk straight forward from the train station up the hill on Horton Street. When you get to the Victoria Theatre continue on Fountain Street. The road bears to the right, then you reach Barum Top roundabout. At the roundabout walk forward on Cow Green. When you reach the traffic lights in front of New Ebeneezer Church turn left and walk up the hill on Pellon Lane. Continue on this road for 0.3 miles, then turn left on Hanson Lane. Continue on Hanson Lane for 0.4 miles, continue on the road at the roundabout. Our centre is on the right just after Bowman Grove. The building nearest the road is our Support Building. The building set back behind the fence is our Activities Building. Accessibility Interpreters available, so please ask. We have an access ramp into our centre grounds and the ground floors in both our Support building and Activities building are accessible. There is an accessible toilet in our Support building. Please let us know if you have any specific access needs and we will always try meet your needs. Contact info@staugustinescentrehalifax.org.uk 01422 352492 St Augustine’s Centre Hanson Lane Halifax HX1 5PG Send us a message Quick links Jobs Volunteer Financial Report 2023 Articles of Association (Governance) Site Credits Privacy Statement Cookie Policy Accreditation St. Augustine’s Centre, Halifax is a company limited by guarantee (number 06819800) and a registered charity (number 1131784) St. Augustine’s Centre, Halifax is regulated in the UK by the IAA with the authorisation number N201900079 MyLivingWage accreditation: 3 August 2023 ILPA member: 9056 AgencyForGood Copyright 2025. All Rights Reserved

Summer at Journey Messages Give LiveStream Leadership Team New Here Find Us Plan a Visit Leadership Team Journey Church Staff Team Scott Edinger Lead Pastor scott@journeysherwood.org Olivia Pothoff Pastor of Worship & Care olivia@journeysherwood.org Gabe Nielsen Director of Journey Youth gabe@journeysherwood.org Olivia Cuddeford Director of Journey Kids oliviac@journeysherwood.org Journey Church Leadership Board The Leadership Board at Journey Church is made up of six members of the Journey Church family and the Lead Pastor. They are assigned to help guide, equip, and empower the pastors and staff at Journey Church to fulfill the mission and vision that God has uniquely given us. Our current Leadership Board members: Megan O’Connell, Jon Burgi, Lacey McNay, Ed Hatch, Amy Schlapper, Josh Thoreson. If you have any questions for the Leadership Board please email: leadershipboard@journeysherwood.org Back to Top Events Messages FOLLOWING JESUS TOGETHER Phone 503.610.0759 Email info@journeysherwood.org Gather 22689 SW Pine Street, Sherwood, OR Mail PO Box 322, Sherwood, OR 97140 Subscribe To Our Weekly Update Sign up with your email address to receive our weekly email updates. Castillo Dr St. Augustine , FL 32084 UNIDOS EN LA MÚSICA (UNITED IN MUSIC): A LATIN AMERICAN FESTIVAL Saturday, May 4, 2024 The Annual Unidos en la Música (United in Music) Festival celebrates Latin American art, music, dance, sports, games, and food. The all-day festival will be held from 10:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. on Saturday, May 4, 2024, at Francis Field. Unidos en la Música features a spectacular variety of art, live entertainment, quality merchandise, dance workshops, and great food. The family-friendly event showcases games, Latin dances, and award winning-musical performers. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing. If you have a civil rights or Americans with Disabilities Act ( ADA ) complaint regarding your ability to participate in a City program or activity please contact the City Clerk at: City of St. Augustine Darlene Galambos, City Clerk 75 King Street, PO Box 210 St. Augustine, FL 32085 Phone: 904-825-1007 Email the City Clerk For more information visit our Legal Notices & Disclaimers Page Si usted tiene una queja con respecto a su capacidad para participar en un programa o actividad de la Ciudad en acuerdo con la Ley de Estadounidenses con Discapacidades o sus derechos civiles, por favor llame al Secretario de la Ciudad al 904-825-1007 . AUGUSTINE Arts & Culture ARTIST PROFILES PUBLIC ART Cultural Trails Accord Trail Touch – Braille Trail Oldest In History Neighborhoods Neighborhoods Guide Organization Type Association/Club/Group Commercial Business Corporation Dance Educational Environmental Faith Based/Religious Festivals Film/Video Food/Drink Foundation Gallery/Museum Gift Shop Government History/Heritage Kids/Family Library Literature/Poetry Lodging Media Music Nonprofit Performing Arts Retail Sports/Outdoor Theatre Tours Traditional Arts Travel Visual Arts State / Province FL City/Town Armstrong Crescent Beach Elkton Fruit Cove Hastings Palm Coast Palm Valley Ponte Vedra Ponte Vedra Beach St. Augustine St. Augustine Beach St. Augustine Shores Switzerland Vilano Beach Zip/Postal Code 32004 32033 32080 32081 32082 32084 32085 32086 32092 32095 32135 32137 32142 32145 32164 32259 SEARCH Advanced Filters Home Organization Sing Out Loud Festival Facebook Twitter Linkedin Print Sing Out Loud Festival Every September, the Sing Out Loud Festival has brought hundreds of local, regional, and nationally renowned performers to various stages and parks throughout the county and entertained more than 50,000 music fans of all genres. Locals and visitors alike will experience why September is the Unofficial Month of Music in St. Johns County. And whether it’s R&B, bluegrass, hip-hop, or indie rock, there’s something for everybody. The festival is highlighted by headline performers at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre. Sing Out Loud Festival takes place each September and features free and ticketed concerts, plus artist workshops. The festival is produced by St. Johns County Cultural Events Division (which operates The St. Augustine Amphitheatre and Ponte Vedra Concert Hall), St. Johns County Tourist Development Council, and St. Johns County Cultural Council. Since its inception in 2016, the festival has welcomed an estimated 50,000 music fans and featured more than 900 artists while raising over $300,000 for charitable organizations. Oct 1, 2023 Facebook Twitter Linkedin TICKETS / REGISTRATION SHOW MORE Contact information Email / Website / Facebook / Instagram / Primary address: St. Augustine, FL 32084 (904) 209-0367 Find An Organization Search by Keyword Organization Type Association/Club/Group Commercial Business Corporation Dance Educational Environmental Faith Based/Religious Festivals Film/Video Food/Drink Foundation Gallery/Museum Gift Shop Government History/Heritage Kids/Family Library Literature/Poetry Lodging Media Music Nonprofit Performing Arts Retail Sports/Outdoor Theatre Tours Traditional Arts Travel Visual Arts State / Province FL City/Town Armstrong Crescent Beach Elkton Fruit Cove Hastings Palm Coast Palm Valley Ponte Vedra Ponte Vedra Beach St. Augustine St. Augustine Beach St. Augustine Shores Switzerland Vilano Beach Zip/Postal Code 32004 32033 32080 32081 32082 32084 32085 32086 32092 32095 32135 32137 32142 32145 32164 32259 Featured Organizations EMMA Concert Association Presenting beautiful music in beautiful St. Augustine at the Lewis Auditorium at Flagler College! EMMA’s mission is to offer quality music and dance performances by national and international artists. They also aim to encourage interest in classical music and to provide opportunities for the youth of St. Johns County. EMMA accomplishes this by offering school concerts in local schools and funding requests from music teachers for instruments and equipment. Historic Florida Militia The Historic Florida Militia (HFM) is a non-profit umbrella organization supporting re-created historic interpretive units and representing a number of cultures and time periods. "We are not street performers, we are educators. We are not parades, we are historic programs. This is not an exercise in free speech, this is an opportunity to educate. We are not promoting a political agenda, we are promoting the city's history through a practical and factual teaching method". Crisp-Ellert Art Museum at Flagler College Built in honor of Dr. JoAnn Crisp-Ellert and her husband, Dr. Robert Ellert, the Crisp-Ellert Art Museum offers Flagler College students and the Northeast Florida community a venue for fostering knowledge and a deep appreciation of contemporary art. As an educational resource for the College, the Museum exhibits regional, national and international artists, and provides opportunities for critical engagement and exposure to a variety of exhibitions and personal interactions with visiting artists. The Museum challenges students, the Flagler community and the public to cultivate individual creativity, critical reflection, historical consciousness and respect for the free exchange of ideas. In this spirit, the Museum also hosts public programs, including artist talks, readings, panel discussions and film series that provide a platform for vital interdisciplinary dialogue. St. Augustine Music Festival 2025 Presented by St. Augustine Music Festival at Cathedral Basilica of St. Augustine , St. Augustine FL Jun 19 - 29 2025 St. Augustine Music Festival Six FREE Concerts of classical music presented over the last two weekends in June. TICKETS / REGISTRATION The St. Augustine Music Festival (SAMF) celebrates its 19th season of presenting free world-class concerts in the historic Cathedral Basilica in St. Augustine, Florida. Each concert begins at 7:30 PM. Visit staugustinemusicfestival.org for complete information. WEEK ONE THURSDAY, June 19 | Juneteenth Celebration Celebrate Juneteenth, James Weldon Johnson’s birthday, and the 125th anniversary of Lift Every Voice and Sing with the Ritz Chamber Players and soprano Ann Marie McPhail, featuring works by African-American composers. FRIDAY, June 20 | “Season’s Best” Featuring violinist Nigel Armstrong in Piazzolla’s Four Seasons of Buenos ... view more » The St. Augustine Music Festival (SAMF) celebrates its 19th season of presenting free world-class concerts in the historic Cathedral Basilica in St. Augustine, Florida. Each concert begins at 7:30 PM. Visit staugustinemusicfestival.org for complete information. WEEK ONE THURSDAY, June 19 | Juneteenth Celebration Celebrate Juneteenth, James Weldon Johnson’s birthday, and the 125th anniversary of Lift Every Voice and Sing with the Ritz Chamber Players and soprano Ann Marie McPhail, featuring works by African-American composers. FRIDAY, June 20 | “Season’s Best” Featuring violinist Nigel Armstrong in Piazzolla’s Four Seasons of Buenos Aires and Mendelssohn’s String Symphony No. 8. SATURDAY, June 21 | “Piano Spectacular” A virtuosic evening with pianist Chelsea Wang and violinist Gabriela Peña performing works by Franck, Ravel, and Chopin. SUNDAY, June 22 | “Bach to Mozart” Enjoy the world premiere of Piotr Szewczyk’s Sinfonietta, plus Webern’s Langsamer Satz, Bach’s Brandenburg Concerto No. 1, and Mozart’s Exsultate, Jubilate featuring soprano Maria Valdes. WEEK TWO FRIDAY, June 27 | “Songs of Joy” The St. Augustine Invitational Choral Festival presents Rutter’s Magnificat and uplifting performances by the Jacksonville and Indianapolis Children’s Choirs. SATURDAY, June 28 | “Perfect Balance and Beauty” Featuring chamber gems by Dvořák, Puccini, Shaw, Saint-Saëns, and the world premiere of Rhythmic Colors by rising composer Alex Cooper. SUNDAY, June 29 | “Mozart and More” Mozart’s Symphony No. 35, Vivaldi’s Mandolin Concerto, and the return of Piotr Szewczyk’s St. Augustine Suite for its 10th anniversary. View less ADMISSION INFO Free Website: https://staugustinemusicfestival.org/ LOCATION Cathedral Basilica of St. Augustine 38 Cathedral Place, St. Augustine, FL 32084 View in Google Maps Accessibility Information: Currently, no accessibility information is available for this event. Coming Together for the Arts The Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts Board and Staff is a dedicated team of artists, artisans, administrators and theater professionals committed to our audiences and the Kauffman Center’s mission, vision and values. We believe in the power of the performing arts to inspire and connect Kansas City to the arts. We work tirelessly to create unforgettable experiences that touch the hearts and souls of all who attend. The Kauffman Center ticket office may be reached by phone at 816.994.7222 or you can fill out our contact form . Use Our Calendar of Events to Plan Your Stay in St Augustine Florida St. Augustine, FL (904) 827-5740 Sign In Stay Accommodations Amenities Wine Bar About About the Inn Gallery Press Offers Specials, Packages & Enhancements Gift Certificates Events Groups & Private Events Calendar of Events Nights of Lights Sing Out Loud Explore History of St. Augustine Attractions Restaurants & Bars Blog FAQ Frequently Asked Questions Policies Pet Policy Directions & Contact BOOK Sign In Why Book Direct Calendar of Events Find the Latest and Greatest Events in the Oldest City In Old St. Augustine, FL, our city hosts all types of events from historic to culinary to musical. The ancient city is home to a variety of events including concerts, art exhibits, festivals, seasonal holiday celebrations, live theater, and many other fun activities. Many of which happen annually! St. Augustine welcomes thousands of visitors every year to its events, from the award-winning Nights of Lights holiday season to fun spring festivals and markets. It is also a great hub for lovers of food, wine, and beer as we have many events celebrating all three. Find out about holiday happenings such as the Fourth of July fireworks, the New Year's Eve Beach Blast Off, and the Easter Parade. No matter the season, there's always something big happening in St. Augustine. At St. George Inn , we have a lot of favorite events throughout the year in the ancient city. Many of our team members have lived in Old St. Augustine for decades, and we love to recommend the can’t miss happenings that we’ve grown to love. The St. Augustine Amphitheatre is a state of the art, internationally known performing arts venue consistently ranked among Pollstar Magazine's Top 50 Amphitheater Venues Worldwide. Musical icons including Bob Dylan, Stevie Nicks, John Legend, Robert Plant, Aretha Franklin, Willie Nelson, Bonnie Raitt and hundreds more have taken the stage. Although, The St. Augustine Amphitheatre is now best known as a world-class music venue, it was constructed for a singular purpose - as the stage and setting for a symphonic outdoor drama by Pulitzer-prize winning playwright, Paul Green. Before the blistering summer hits, St. Augustine kicks off the end of spring with the beloved St. Augustine Food & Wine Festival in May. The festival is a culinary celebration to showcase food, beverage and culture that highlights celebrity guest chefs, celebrity winemakers/ proprietors, local chefs, artisans and local craft spirits/beers. The festival offers a wide variety of events for all taste buds, from wine dinners and tasting events, to master classes and more. World Golf Village, San Sebastian Winery and the Hyatt Place, St. Augustine/Vilano Beach are the host location sites for the 2025 festival. World Golf Village is located 20 minutes north of historic downtown St. Augustine and the beaches. For our millennial visitors, As If! The ‘90s Fest is a fun, nostalgia-inducing event that will give you a blast from the past. Presented by Ancient City Entertainment, St. Augustine's As If! '90s Fest celebrates the '90s trends, fashions, and moments on Saturday, May 17, 2025, at Francis Field. The festival supports Ace Alliance, a non-profit organization passionate about entertainment, tourism, and hospitality. All the trappings of the '90s will be part of this celebration of the decade, including a fly photo booth and water slide. Food trucks, music, and fun will be found at this family-friendly event. St. George Inn is also the proud owner of Bin 39 Wine Bar , one of the best places to grab a glass of wine in St. Augustine. We have live music every weekend as well as weekdays during busy seasons. Stop by and listen to local musicians while enjoying the best wine list in North Florida. Bin 39 also hosts several themed events throughout the year like Bin Book Club, Galentine's Day, and several Specialty Wine Tasting events with winemakers and sommeliers. Explore this calendar of events when planning your visit to the nation’s oldest city, also visit St. George and Bin 39’s social media and websites for feature events throughout the year. Featured Communities Neighborhoods Regions Guide Apartments Homes Construction Contractors Government Services Healthcare Home Services Lenders Places of Worship Real Estate Services Schools Utilities Search St. Augustine Music Festival - 2025 Local classical musicians perform chamber music at free concerts. Select Days, Fri., Jun. 20 - Sun., Jun. 29, 2025 | 7:30 p.m. St. Augustine Music Festival - 2025 (646) 565-8504 Across from the north side of the Plaza. 38 Cathedral Pl. St. Augustine, FL 32084 View Google Map Share This +2 more The largest free classical music festival in the United States, St. Augustine Music Festival (SAMF), presents six live performances at the Cathedral Basilica in June of 2025. Scheduled for two weeks on Fridays through Sundays from June 20 to June 29, 2025, the festival features musicians from the Jacksonville Symphony Orchestra and often includes internationally renowned guest artists. This is the festival's 19th season. St. Augustine Music Festival Sponsored by the St. Johns Cultural Council, St. Johns County Tourist Development Council, and the Community Foundation for Northeast Florida, the festival was founded in 2007 by Jacksonville Symphony Orchestra members Jorge A. Peña (viola) and Jin Kim-Peña (cello), who encouraged other orchestra musicians and soloists to participate in the festival. For more details regarding the St. Augustine Music Festival, please visit here. Admission : Free. When: Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays, from Friday, June 20 through Sunday, June 29, at 7:30 p.m. Where : Concerts are held at the Cathedral Basilica, 38 Cathedral Place in historic downtown St. Augustine, Florida 32084. The 2025 Concerts Annual Juneteenth Concert In addition to the six concerts in their normal season, SAMF presents a concert to honor Juneteenth. Go here to learn about the Thursday, June 19th concert . Friday, June 20, at 7:30 p.m. — Season's Best Chamber music, featuring violinist Nigel Armstrong. (See program below.) Saturday, June 21, at 7:30 p.m. — Piano Spectacular\ Featuring Chelsea Wang on piano. ( See program below.) Sunday, June 22, at 7:30 p.m. — Bach to Mozart Featuring Maria Valdes, soprano and Jorge Peña, conductor. (See program below.) Friday, June 27, at 7:30 p.m. — Celestial Sounds with More Than 100 Voices Featuring more than 100 children and youth singers. (See program below.) Saturday, June 28, at 7:30 p.m. — Perfect Balance and Beauty Two pieces for string quartet, and one septet with piano, trumpet, and strings. Featuring local composer Alex Cooper. (See program below.) Sunday, June 29, at 7:30 p.m. — Mozart and More Chamber Orchestra (See program below.) Programs for Each Concert June 20, 2025, Chamber Music: Season's Best Astor Piazzolla: Four Seasons of Buenos Aires, featuring Nigel Armstrong, violin I. Vernao Porteño (Buenos Aires Summer) II. Invierno Porteño (Buenos Aires Winter) III. Primavera Porteña (Buenos Aires Spring) IV. Otoño Porteño (Buenos Aires Autumn) Felix Mendelssohn: String Symphony No. 8 in D minor/major, MWV N8 (1822) I. Adagio e grave—Allegro II. Adagio III. Menetto—Trio. Presto IV. Allegro molto June 21, 2025, Piano Spectacular Featuring pianist Chelsea Wang. Claude Debussy: Estampes I. Pagodes II. La soirées fans Grenade III. Jardins sous la pluie Frédérick Chopin: Ballade no. 4, F minor Intermission Maurice Ravel: Valse Nobles et Sentimentales I. Modéré—très franc II. Assez lent—avec une expression intense III. Modéré IV. Assez animé V. Presque lent—dans un sentiment intime VI. Vif VII. Moins Vif VIII. Épilogue:  lent Nicolai Kapustine: Variations, op.41 June 22, 2025, Chamber Orchestra: Bach to Mozart Featuring the soprano Maria Valdes and conductor Jorge Peña. The orchestra premieres Sinfoietta for String Orchestra, by violinist Piotr Szewczy of the Jacksonville Symphony Orchestra. Anton Webern:  Langsamer Satz Johann Sebastian Bach: Brandenburg Concerto No 1 I. Allegro II. Adagio III. Alegro IV. Menuet – Trio I – Menuet da capo – Polacca – Menuet da capo – Trio II – Menuet Piotr Szewczy: Sinfonietta for String Orchestra I. Subdued II. Flowing III. Urgent Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: Exsultate Jubliate, K.165/158a (1773) featuring Maria Valdes, Soprano I. Allegro. Excultate, jubilate II. Recitativo. Fulget amica dies Andante III. Tu virginum corona IV. Allegro. Alleluja June 27, 2025, St. Augustine Invitational Choral Festival: Celestial Sounds Featuring three children's choirs participating in the St. Augustine International Choral Festival. Frampton Sachiko is the pianist, Darren Faile is the artistic director and a conductor, and Josh Pedde is also a conductor for this concert. Jacksonville Children's Chorus Touring Choir and Voices of Jacksonville The Indianapolis Children's Choir The St. Augustine Invitational Choral Youth Choir Performed by the Jacksonville Children's Chorus Touring Choir and Voices of Jacksonville: John Rutter: Magnificat I.         Magnificat anima mea II.        Et exsultavit III.       Quia respexit IV.       Et misericordia V.        Fecit potentiam VI.       Deposuit potentes VII.      Esurientes VIII.     Suscepit Israel IX.       Gloria Intermission Performed by the Jacksonville Children's Choir Darla Eshelman: Come Bring Me a Song Arr. Audrey Snyder: Rainbow Connection Kyle Pederson: Be the Bridge Arr. Daniel M. Cason II: Unity Performed by the St. Augustine Invitational Youth Choir Darla Eshelman: The Lord is My Shepherd GA Henning: Laudamus Te Leeann Starkey: Now is the Time Harry Richardson: The Star Richard A. Whiting: Where the Orange Blossoms Grow Jill Friedersdorf: Uphill Rollo Dilworth: I Sing Because I'm Happy June 28, 2025, Chamber Music: Perfect Balance and Beaut y Featuring local composer, Alex Cooper. Cooper's style blends traditional tonal harmonies and classic structural forms with a narrative-driven sound, characterized by clear themes and expressive, emotionally resonant language. Antonín Dvorák: String Quintet in G, Op. 77 I. Allegro con fuoco II. Scherzo. Allegro vivace III. Poco andante IV. Finale. Allegro assai Giacomo Puccini: "Crisantemi" for string quartet I. Adante Mesto Alex Cooper: Rhythmic Colors Caroline Shaw: Valencia for String Quartet Camille Saint-Saëns: Septet for Piano, Trumpet & Strings Op.65' I. Préambule:  Allegro moderato—Più allegro II. Menuet: Tempo di menuetto moderato III. Intermède:  Andante IV. Gavotte et Final:   Alegro non troppo—Animato June 29, 2025, Chamber Orchestra: Mozart and More The program and season concludes with St. Augustine Suite for Chamber Orchestra, composed by Priotr Szewczyk. The piece is presented on the tenth anniversary of its premiere and to honor the 460th anniversary of the founding of St. Augustine. Antonio Vivaldi: Concerto for Mandolin, in C major, RV 425 I. Allegro II. Largo III. Allegro Wolfgan Amadeus Mozart: Symphony 35 Introduction I. Allegro con spirito II. Andante III. Menuetto IV. Presto Piotor Szewczyk: St. Augustine Suite for Chamber Orchestra I. Timucua II. Atlantic Dreams III.
